reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: Now that I can actually play the game since the crashing issue is fixed (thanks devs) I will post a full review.

It's hard for me to recommend this or not. There's such a low amount of players on simultaneously, yet the gameplay seems like it would be very fun if there were players frequently playing together. I haven't had a chance to test out the game with a full minimum lobby of players (6) without bots. If you're going to argue about my hours I am often offline on Steam and my hours do not record.

So here's my review about the game. Pretty much the spacemen must complete the objectives first before the monster kills the spacemen. It follows the general idea of many other objective-based horror games. But even though the developers do borrow this general idea from other games, they have put their own unique twist into the game, locating the gameplay in space and adding a variety of environmental" factors into completing the objectives. For example
date: oxygen is needed for the spacemen
recommended: so their time to complete objectives outside is limited
hoursPlayed: allowing the monster to take advantage of their need for oxygen.\n\nI do admit the visuals are quite good-looking for the alpha state of the game. The HUD looks great and the dark and lonely feeling of space are very present. I've known this developer team since their last unfinished game

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIn the game's current state, there are some bugs that can make playing it frustrating. For instance sometimes you dont spawn in at all so you are unable to participate in the game, all you can do is stare at the wall of the room you were supposed to spawn in, and you cant open the menu in this state so you have to force shut down the game. There is also a bug that allows a player to be the monster multiple times in a row, and some other minor bugs like people spawning in with no assigned color and not being able to open the map the whole round. The game can be fun when everything works properly, but the bugs I mentioned before can make it annoying. In its current state I cannot recommend this game, but it has potential, so I would recommend following it so you can see if these bugs are fixed.

Basically a non-scary, poor mans Damned ( http://store.steampowered.com/app/251170/ ) in space.

Ugly character models and animations along with typical, slight stat increasing, upgrades try to distract from the fact the gameplay is just super boring, typical UE jank.
Think tellytubbies running around a spacestation with potato guns being chased by some kind of phallic mole rat monster and your close.

The dev's first game (The Dead Linger) was abandoned and removed from Steam (no refunds given) after a very successful kickstarter and 3 years in early access because they ran out of funds" after paying off mortgages and buying new cars

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What I like:
Gameplay is actually pretty fun.
VOIP is VERY well implemented, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ cheap sounding voip would genuinely screw the game over.
The game has a solid, solid, solid atmosphere especially in the space maps.
The gunplay actually feels good, the animations are â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing solid.
Some bad design is actually pretty good.


What I dislike:
There is an issue with playing two games, not rounds, in a row, you essentially need to reset your game or alt-f4 which is not great.
The colors should be distributed better, it really hampers gameplay imo.

Overall I've recommended this to friends already so it's got my thumbs up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Its pretty cool but really requires more hours.  It has a very scifi feel to it, a pity it cant feature xenomorphs but then Sega might not appreciate that lol

A short but brief review.

-feels like unreal tournament plays like team vs team pvp with objectives think natural selection 2
-has some pretty nice graphics which im sure in time will morph into nicer graphics
-audios not bad, no real problems i noticed, mood feels right
-outside when the oxygen panic sets in has a real emergency feeling rush to that airlock now marine!
-has bot support
-some interesting looking spacemen perks and upgrades

some problems
-obvious bugs, being a first release ea
-sometimes game crashes etc more obvious bugs
-sometimes games dont sync up and there's various errors with networking

If your someone who doesn't mind such problems with ea titles i'd suggest cautiously try it out for an hour if you dont like it get a refund.  Its not going to be an everyone game because of the sort of game it is, however it is fun and i can see it becoming more so once the big issues are resolved.

Many have probably heard that the company that has made this game also made a title before it called The Dead Linger which gained alot of bad publicity much of which was fitting.  However much of the things said about TDL had alot of things mixed in it of personal nature and opinions, the truth was that the company ran out of money and had to halt development on TDL.  There is still very mild speculation from a few people that maybe after some successes development might resume but due to the cost most dont believe so.

This company is as honest as they come, they are transperant and those that stuck with the entire process of TDL know this regardless of their personal feelings.  Keys were also just given freely to all Kickstarter backers of TDL as a gesture of good will.

If your not very convinced its a good buy at this point come back to it, but the experience off the hat has been a much more pleasent one and i wish Sandswept the best of luck with this and future titles.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll start off by saying that at time of  writing this, the game is in Alpha.  I see tons of negative reviews praising the gameplay and concept, but crying the game is buggy and un-stable.  No sh!t.  The game is in Alpha, geniuses.

With that said, this game is pretty hysterical, and I typically dislike FPS.  It's basically a 15-minute murder-mystery in space.  The best part is when you're the monster, and hearing the screams and surprise of murdering the spaceman you've been helping for the past three minutes, as he turns and see you suddenly morph.

You can set traps (the air lock decompression is always satisfying) and you can sabotage the power, equipment, etc.  You got to be slick though, because if peeps see you acting weird ... blamo!  Much of the games charm also comes from the in-game voice-chat.  You have to be a little bit of a real-life actor to accidentally" shoot
recommended: drop a flash bang or call people to a room to kill them one-by-one.\n\nThe game is currenly $12.00.  It's buggy as hell
hoursPlayed: but it has great potential and well worth the price in it's current state.  I'd strongly reccomend supporting this one."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unfortunate Spacemen; It is a fun game of paranoia. You're new friend, whos covered your back and helped you, may not be such a nice spaceman; Or even a man.

Unfortunate Spacemen reminds me alot of the game Mafia, roles assigned and lies made, or truths explained. Each to be taken at face value or not, depending on how people portray themselves. This style adds more intrigue, like the dangers of space or hostile worlds. And a monster, hiding in the human flesh.

Worth the money. Worth a try. You'll like it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT 2: Recently I was actually able to get in some games and, over the course of a week or so, found that I was able to consistently get in games with minimal issues. There are still some remnants of the connectivity/loading issues mentioned previously, but the rate at which they appear has been diminished significantly. They might even have gone away entirely since the Sunny Side Up patch but I have not played since that patch was released so I can't verify entirely.

But, that said, the bugs have been worked out to a point that I think is very acceptable for an Early Access game so I am changing this review to a positive! The games I was able to play were fantastic and filled with fun and tension. A lot of it depends on the people you play with, and the more talkative players you can get, the better. Playing as a Spaceman is a fun mix of paranoia and tension and the rounds are a good mix of winning and losing, depending on how the monster plays. There are also numerous ways to go about your objectives as the monster so it varies each round, which keeps things fresh. The 15 minute time limit is a perfect amount of time to get objectives done but also keep you constantly moving and preventing the game from stagnating. There are multiple maps, but all anyone ever plays on is Echo. I tried out some of the other maps but people just mostly complained until I changed it to Echo. That is another downside though is that the game doesn't exit back to lobby and there isn't a way to vote for a map change or even force change it yourself as host at the end of a round or set of rounds.

The things I would recommend being aware of if you are a new player are the small playerbase (not a lot of people are on and you need to play in peak hours to find a game). Basically, don't expect to play outside of the hours of 7ish to midnight. Also, there is a bug (again, SSU patch may have fixed this) where servers will only list 1/31 players in the game, regardless of how many players are actually in it. So you have to join the game to see how active it is.

I would also be aware of the crashing/joining/connection issues. They have, for me, almost gone away entirely, but your experience may vary. Also, again, keep in mind that a lot of your fun depends on other players. I have not had any bad experiences with the community, but as it continues to grow, this could change.

Lastly, the pistol damage seems too small. Everyone starts with it though, so I get that it can't be too powerful, and the balance of heavy weapons on the map seems good because you don't want everyone powered up, but I got into a pistol duel with someone and we shot at each other for literally five straight minutes dancing around and neither one of us died and we eventually just ran in opposite directions. If you have just a pistol and are facing down the monster, it is better to just run.

I don't want to end on a negative note so I will say this: this game has, I believe, a terrific future ahead of it. The devs somehow took a horror setting (imo) and, instead of it becoming less frightening with more players, it just gets scarier. That is an achievement in itself. That's not to say that you won't experience some goofy/funny moments, but the overall feeling is very tense and that is a big positive for a game like this. The devs also seem very active in their work on this. I gather from other reviews that there might be some bad blood from a previous project? I can't speak on that, but I can speak on what I've seen with this game and the updates come frequently and they seem to be very aware of the current issues, what needs to be done to fix them, and where the game is heading.

I would definitely recommend buying this game. It is a unique multiplayer game that blends a lot of elements together in a wonderful way. The more people that play, the better the games get, so I would love to see more players involved. I'm typically very wary of Early Access games, but I can say that from what I have seen with this, it is at a point where you should feel safe investing your time and money into it. It is only going to get better. I hope to see a lot more of you Spacemen out there.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EDIT 1: I played the game since the new patch, and while the crashing problem has gone away, it seems to have been replaced with (or maybe this has always been a problem and I never got far enough to try it) connectivity/loading issues. Mainly, when trying to join, I will get to in-game screen and I can see other Spacemen running around, but will get no options to do anything. If it's not that, then I'll get sent to a black screen where it sticks in an infinite loading screen. Anytime this happens, I am forced to ALT+F4 out because there is no other recourse, so basically it went from crashing on its own to forcing me to crash it. I tried joining after the host sent the game back to the lobby, and I still got slammed into the never-loading start screen when the host started the game again.

I managed to get into and play one game, which was fun (mostly bots, but a handful of real people). We lost due to the time limit, but I had a couple tense, close calls with the monster that were exciting. The gameplay is fun on its own, but the true experience seems like it will be heavily dependent on the people you play with. I am glad that my initial thoughts that it would be fun were validated by it actually being fun.

Unfortunately, I have to leave the review as negative. The general instability as a whole is just too much to be able to overlook it, even in Early Access. Getting into one game out of six attempts is just no bueno. It is a good sign that patches seem to be coming out on a pretty quick basis though, and I have no doubt that eventually (and possibly very soon) this review will turn to Positive, but I just can't do it right now. If it were solely based on the gameplay, it'd already be a Positive, but if I can't get to the gameplay, then what's the point?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ORIGINAL: The concept and gameplay look and sound fun from videos I watched from other people, but that is about all you are going to be able to do. It seems like luck of the draw whether or not the game will run for you. At any point, for any reason it feels like, the game will kick you back to the menu, or completely crash. This can happen in menus, in the lobby select, in-game waiting to start, in-game while you spawn, and just at any point in-game, period. This is even if the game will launch in the first place.

There are numerous other bugs, things you would expect from an Early Access game, so I'm not going to list those. But when the game is near-completely unplayable, it should not be released in any form, at all. I have not once been able to complete a whole match, and the most I ever got to play of a match was three minutes.

tl;dr DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. It has the potential to be something great, but that something will never exist in Early Access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Some of you may be wary of buying into this game because of the developer's history with the failed game; The Dead Linger. Now luckily, I know the story behind TDL and I understand that sometimes, sh*t happens. The developers have moved on, and so have we. (They've also given previous owners of TDL a 65% discount on this little gem right here, which is more than generous).

NOW. Bring forth, Unfortunate Spacemen. The concept of this game had me interested right off the bat. Think of a multiplayer game version of the movie The Thing. Sounds too good to be true, right? This game aims to make that a reality. Mind you, that's only one of the many inspirations behind this title. Unfortunate Spacemen truly is a unique, new, creative, and most importantly - fun game to play.

Now of course, it's Early Access and that means some issues, some frustrations, some bugs, and some other bullsh*t. Purchasing" this game is an investment. If you are'nt prepared for some unfortunate stuff to happen during development
date: please don't buy into this. Too many people purchase an EA game so they have something new to b*tch about. Honestly that goes for all games. Right now the only issue I have with Spacemen is the matchmaking. It's very rough
recommended: and hopefully is a top priority BUT - it still works. I had a server going with 18 people connected

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Solid, Plays extremely similar to The ship. You are fist dropped into a map with several other players, a disaster has happened and you must call for rescue and complete objectives. Note that this is all whilst evading a monster that is predetermined at the start of the round.

-Monster must kill all the spessmen, maintain his cover( Monster is able to change other colors whilst in human form)
-Humans complete objectives and await the shuttle rescue.(Clean junk off the landing pads, Eject crates and research samples into spess, turn on transmitters and maintain the power should it be shut off)

-Besides that extremely simple, There are also map pickups which include but aren't limited to: Assault rifles, Flamethrowers, frag and flash grenades.


Reminiscent of my all time favorite game: SS13.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Unfortunate Spacemen
I have spent a bit of time playing and giving feedback for this before it was released on early access, from the first time I played it to now, it's come quite a way. I was an original backer for TDL as well, also a moderator on the sandswept forums. This is entirely my opinion and no, Zag did not buy me a WRX for it :(

This is game where players are pitted to complete objectives, escape all at the same time whilst being hunted by a monster.

Now you're probably reading reviews for a simple reason on why you should purchase this.
Well heres a few reasons.
If you liked playing a situation where you're always being hunted by a monster and can't trust nobody?
Then it's for you (for instance, if you liked murder/TTT/Morbus ect from Garry's Mod you will enjoy this)
You want to be a part of helping by giving feedback to the developers
Want a game to play with mates
For this game, so far it's travelling a lot smoother then TDL did and I'd highly recommend it for those that want to give feedback and improve upon the game as a community.

Yes it's alpha, yes it has lots of bugs/crashes but the game really worths it for the low price. It is a simple but very very fun game that you can enjoy alone or with friends.

Don't stop playing just because your screen is frozen or you lose connection to the servers. It can happen for a first version but it's their top priority to fix atm. Once you get in a game, you really enjoy it, trust me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very fun game. Great VOIP. Great atmosphere. Obviously has lots of bugs, most fixable by a restart or just not that big to care about. Example: I spawned in twice as a spaceman, without a color, and my portrait was only a visor. Hilarious!

If you understand what alpha means and either can handle or find amusement in seeing games do things they are not supposed to do, definitely give this game a try. This advice goes for basically all early access games.

It seems that Sandswept has learned from their time on TDL, and I am optimistic about the future of this game (as long as there are no engine changes!!!!!)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is great already at this point, it has bugs and you often have to rejoin lobbies and restart the game but it's in alpha so if you expect a finished game you're the wrong place. But if you are still reading this ill have you know this is one of the best games i have been playing recently.

The games horror and murder nature forces players to interact and work together in order to escape from the monster and if you don't you die. Sometimes the unfortunate spacemen even gang up on the monster and kills it.
There is a load of ways to play the game you have many perks at your dispose already in this state of the game and more to come, Sandwept the dev team have a development roadmap where you can see every planned feature and it's current state which gives a better interaction between players and developers.

I would recommnd you play this, it has great replayability and is great to play with your friend or just random people.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ever play that one mod on Garrys Mod, Murder? It's sort of like that except with a monster guns flame throwers objectives and space.

Gameplay wise it's really fun. Trying to find out who the monster is while completeing objectives not knowing if the guy next to you is going to help you or kill you keeps you on your toes that along side friendly developers that hop in game and play with you and just a very welcoming community this game is a must have.

Game is early access and has its bugs and missing features but as it currently stands it run well it plays even better and it's ton of fun. Buy it you wont regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yes, this game is by a team that failed their last game attempt, but they put SO much work into that I feel VERY confident in this game (and bought about 5 copies for friends... those pennyless poor jerks).

This game is a cross between the movie, The Thing, and the Gmod mode, Murder. One guy is it" and must kill off the others while keeping his secret identity unknown and growing stronger with each death. If you have friends to play with
date: this game is downright amazingly fun. If not
hoursPlayed: it is still quite fun.\n\nThe lacks a lot of features to fully flesh out even the basic gameplay as stands
voteText: such as stopping time when the creature is in the escape shuttle with the spacemen until either side dies. Or making it so the creature can't just burrow in the corner and wait out the round with just a little sabotage.\n\nAll in all
votesHelpful: with a dedicated dev team that tries their best."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I was lucky enough to playtest this game, and man has it come a long way!

What can I say, space-based murder in space! I've never screamed and laughed so much at a game. It's a great way to find mistrust in your most trustworthy friends! It has a really cool graphic style too.
Once again, hilarious and terrifying all at once :) Give it a try!

Update 5/11/2016:
So I've had a handful of days playing with the public. And man is it hilarious! Hours of laughing, screaming, and paranoia. I love it!
